processType.description: Type of ALE process, either thermal or plasma-based.

chemicalPrecursors.description: List of chemical precursors used in the ALE process, e.g., Cl2, HF, SF6, Al(CH3)3.

energySource.description: Type of energy source used, e.g., thermal energy or plasma excitation.

substrateMaterial.description: Material of the substrate being etched, including type and chemical composition.

type.description: Type of the substrate material, e.g., semiconductor, dielectric, or metal film.

chemicalComposition.description: Chemical composition of the substrate material, e.g., SiO2, Al2O3, GaN.

length.description: Length of the substrate model in nanometers.

width.description: Width of the substrate model in nanometers.

thickness.description: Thickness of the substrate model in nanometers.

surfaceArea.description: Surface area of the substrate model in square nanometers.

surfaceProperties.description: Properties related to the substrate surface.

surfaceOrientation.description: Orientation of the substrate surface, e.g., (111), (100), (110).

surfaceFacet.description: Specific facet of the surface, e.g., (111), (100), (110).

termination.description: Termination of the surface, e.g., hydrogen-terminated, oxygen-terminated.

latticeParameters.description: Breakdown of the lattice parameters for the substrate model.

lengths.description: Lengths of the unit cell edges in angstroms.

a.description: Length of the a-axis in angstroms.

b.description: Length of the b-axis in angstroms.

c.description: Length of the c-axis in angstroms.

angles.description: Angles between the unit cell edges in degrees.

alpha.description: Angle between b and c axes in degrees.

beta.description: Angle between a and c axes in degrees.

gamma.description: Angle between a and b axes in degrees.

spaceGroup.description: Space group of the crystal structure.

atomicCoordinates.description: List of atomic or crystallographic coordinates.

element.description: Chemical element symbol, e.g., Si, O.

x.description: X-coordinate of the atom in fractional coordinates.

y.description: Y-coordinate of the atom in fractional coordinates.

z.description: Z-coordinate of the atom in fractional coordinates.

temperature.description: Temperature at which the ALE process is conducted.

precursorGasFlowRate.description: Flow rate of precursor gas in standard cubic centimeters per minute (sccm).

carrierGasFlowRate.description: Flow rate of carrier gas in standard cubic centimeters per minute (sccm).

plasmaPower.description: Power of plasma used in plasma-enhanced ALE, in watts.

exposureTime.description: Duration of exposure for each cycle in seconds.

processParameters.description: Parameters that define the ALE process conditions, in the case of reactor scale modelling.

etchedMaterial.description: Description of the material that has been etched at the atomic scale.

byProducts.description: List of volatile compounds produced as by-products that need to be evacuated.

surfaceModifications.description: Description of chemical modifications on the surface post-etching.

decompositionMechanisms.description: Description of decomposition and binding/chemisorption mechanisms.

excitationDynamics.description: Study of photon excitation effects on reaction mechanisms.

etchRate.description: Rate of etching per cycle or per unit time.

surfaceDesorptionRates.description: Rates of desorption, diffusion, and reaction on the surface.

bindingAffinity.description: Energy barriers and likelihood of adsorbate binding to the surface.

uniformity.description: Uniformity of the film after etching.

roughness.description: Roughness of the film surface post-etching.

temperatureProfile.description: Thermal conduction and temperature profile of the film.

chemicalComposition.description: Elemental analysis of the film's chemical composition.

gapDistance.description: Gap distance in the reactor, in micrometers.

purgeFlowRate.description: Flow rate of purge gas in sccm.

vacuumPressure.description: Vacuum pressure in the reactor, in Pascals.

designVariables.description: Design variables that affect the reactor scale modelling.

fluorinationAgent.description: Chemical agent used for fluorination, e.g., HF.

fluorinationCoverage.description: Coverage of fluorination on the surface in HF/nm^2.

selfLimitingTemperature.description: Temperature below which the fluorination reaction is self-limiting.

fluorinationDetails.description: Details about the fluorination steps (if fluorination is used).

reactionType.description: Type of reaction, either self-limiting or continuous vapor etch (CVE).

reactionFreeEnergy.description: Free energy change of the reaction in electronvolts (eV).

minimumThermodynamicBarrier.description: Minimum thermodynamic barrier for the reaction in electronvolts (eV).

selfLimitingReaction.description: Details about the self-limiting and CVE reactions.

ionType.description: Type of inert gas ion used in the desorption step, e.g., Ar, Kr, Xe.

ionEnergy.description: Energy of inert gas ions used in the desorption step, in electronvolts (eV).

ionDose.description: Ion dose used in the desorption step, in ions/cm^2.

oxidantType.description: Type of oxidant used in the oxidation step, e.g., O2.

oxidantEnergy.description: Energy of oxidant ions used, in electronvolts (eV).

oxidantDose.description: Dose of oxidant ions used, in ions/cm^2.

oxidationStep.description: Details of the oxidation step in the PE-ALE process.

inertGasIrradiation.description: Parameters specific to inert gas ion irradiation in PE-ALE processes.

simulationMethodology.description: Parameters and methodologies used in the ALE simulation.

methods.description: Computational methods used in the ALE process simulation.

methodDetails.description: Details specific to the computational methods used.

functional.description: Functional used in DFT calculations, e.g., PBE.

basisSet.description: Basis set used in quantum chemical calculations, e.g., plane-wave basis.

convergenceCriteria.description: Convergence criteria used in simulations, e.g., energy convergence threshold.

method.description: Method used to obtain the data (e.g., simulation, experiment)
